{"step_by_step_thinking": "Since the patient is planning to travel to Ethiopia next month, we need to consider malaria prophylaxis. Folic acid and iron supplement medications are not relevant to this question. Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication commonly used for prophylaxis in areas where chloroquine-sensitive Plasmodium falciparum is present. Since the patient will be traveling to Ethiopia, it's likely that P. falciparum is prevalent there. Considering these facts, chloroquine is a suitable option for pre-exposure prophylaxis against malaria.", "answer_choice": C}
